metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9300 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
plugins\codec\libflac_plugin.dll in VideoLAN VLC media player 2.2.4 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap corruption andapplication crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a craftedFLAC file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
libvlccore8 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-data - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-nox - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-samba - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.4').
